extendedIngredients.name: olive oil
extendedIngredients.original: 1/2 cup extra-virgin olive oil, plus more for brushing
extendedIngredients.originalName: extra-virgin olive oil, plus more for brushing

title: Grilled Duck Breasts and Endives with Rosemary-Juniper Oil
summary: Grilled Duck Breasts and Endives with Rosemary-Juniper Oil might be just the main course you are searching for. One serving contains 455 calories, 45g of protein, and 28g of fat. This recipe serves 6 and costs $7.36 per serving. It is perfect for The Fourth Of July. Not a lot of people made this recipe, and 1 would say it hit the spot. It is a good option if you're following a caveman, gluten free, dairy free, and primal diet. If you have belgian endives, salt and pepper, juniper berries, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. To use up the rosemary you could follow this main course with the Raspberry Brie Dessert Pizza with Rosemary and Candied Pecans as a dessert. With a spoonacular score of 83%, this dish is super. Try Apricot Grilled Duck Breasts, Grilled Spiced Duck Breasts with Blackberries, and Grilled Duck Breasts with Cherry Plum Sauce for similar recipes.
instructions: In a small saucepan, combine the 1/2 cup olive oil with the rosemary and juniper berries. Simmer over low heat for 2 minutes. Remove from the heat, cover and let stand for at least 20 minutes.                                               Light a grill. Brush the endives with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Grill over a low fire, turning, for about 20 minutes, or until the endives are almost tender. Transfer the endives to a platter and cover loosely with foil.                                               Season the duck breasts with salt and pepper and grill, skin side down, over a moderately hot fire for 4 minutes. Turn the duck breasts and grill for 3 minutes longer for medium rare. Transfer the duck to a carving board to rest for about 5 minutes. Slice the duck breasts crosswise 1/2 inch thick and arrange the slices on a large warmed platter. Return the endives to the grill briefly to reheat, then add to the platter. Drizzle the duck with the rosemary-juniper oil and serve.

steps.step: In a small saucepan, combine the 1/2 cup olive oil with the rosemary and juniper berries. Simmer over low heat for 2 minutes.
Remove from the heat, cover and let stand for at least 20 minutes.
Brush the endives with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Grill over a low fire, turning, for about 20 minutes, or until the endives are almost tender.
Transfer the endives to a platter and cover loosely with foil.
Season the duck breasts with salt and pepper and grill, skin side down, over a moderately hot fire for 4 minutes. Turn the duck breasts and grill for 3 minutes longer for medium rare.

Transfer the duck to a carving board to rest for about 5 minutes. Slice the duck breasts crosswise 1/2 inch thick and arrange the slices on a large warmed platter. Return the endives to the grill briefly to reheat, then add to the platter.
Drizzle the duck with the rosemary-juniper oil and serve.
